item.title: China Raises Easing Border Controls With Other Countries
item.description: China has approached a number of countries to discuss the possibility of easing border controls to allow some business travel to resume, part of broader efforts to restart economic activity stalled by the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: New Face of Mexico Charity: Drug Lord 'El Chapo'
item.description: The incarcerated cartel chief’s daughter is glorifying his image by using it on charitable gifts, showing the enduring popularity of a notorious criminal whose deadly exploits provide inspiration for TV movies and traditional ballads.

item.title: With Trump Facing Virus Crisis, U.S. Warns Rivals Not to Seek Advantage
item.description: The U.S. and its allies are seeking to head off any attempt by adversaries around the world to test U.S. resolve, amid worries that the health crisis is diverting the White House and military’s attention.

item.title: China Rolls Out Pilot Test of Digital Currency
item.description: China’s central bank has introduced a homegrown digital currency across four cities as part of a pilot program, marking a milestone on the path toward the first electronic payment system by a major central bank.

item.title: Bondholders Reject Argentina's Debt Restructuring Proposal
item.description: Three of the largest groups of Argentine bondholders rejected a proposal from the South American nation to restructure tens of billions of dollars in foreign debt, raising the likelihood that the country enter into default as early as next month.

item.title: Muslim Communities Sustain Ramadan Traditions, at a Distance
item.description: Muslims are planning virtual gatherings as most countries remain under lockdown and social distancing precludes communal meals.
